reviewText:
First impressions (1hr and half in):

RPGmaker title, no doubt about it. But with that being said, attention to detail with the map tilesets is noticable - they took time and showed care for the creation of the areas I've seen so far.

Character designs and pixel art are of good quality (within the confines of the engine), and the characters themselves are expressive enough visually to keep a scenes mood intact. Translation quality flows well enough, though personality of the characters so far seem to lack something" - not sure what - but they feel a bit flat. More time playing may fix that though.

Standard Jrpg music
recommended: but nothing amazing either. Japanese voiceacting during combat is a personal plus for me
hoursPlayed: adds alot of personality. :) Unfortunately full voiceacting outside of combat does not exist - I assume it was just too out of reach for the devs. =/\n\nGameplay reminds me of a mix of Xenogears
voteText: and Star Ocean 2. If I had a complaint - using a controller is a bit twitchy/sensitve during combat
helpfulPercent: as my 360 controllers' dpad does not work within the game
votesHelpful: and instead I have to fiddle with the combat menu using the joystick. But that's more a personal gripe.\n\nEnjoying it up to now - it's not a fancy
votesTotal: next-gen game - but it has noticable
commentsCount: and likeable visuals. And so far the gameplay is fun."

reviewText:
(Disclaimer: I was the QA lead for Sekai Project's localization of Machina of the Planet Tree -Planet Ruler- so feel free to take this with the entire salt shaker.)

Planet Ruler is an amazingly fun and adorable indie JRPG. I'm a fan of JRPGs in general, so I was expecting to enjoy working on this when I got the opportunity, but between the battle system and the catg-- I mean, the way I ended up really liking all of the characters, it exceeded my expectations.

To get the one big downside out of the way first, it's not all that long - I'd ballpark it as being around 7-10 hours for a playthrough that doesn't get stuck on any of the bosses, but it's hard for me to say because I had access to the game files so I knew a lot of the game's inner workings and also had to spend time checking every little thing, both of which distorted my playtime significantly. It's also fairly linear, with no real sidequests other than finding the items needed to upgrade your party's weapons.

But past that, it has a fairly unique battle system where you string attacks together using a Cost" system - basically action points - and deal additional damage on later hits
date: based on both the number of attacks used
recommended: and the number of hits those attacks each dealt. Figuring out what enemies are weak to and then setting up a string of attacks that both builds up the combo meter and strings as many TP-costing "Over-Arts" as you can into the mix without using more TP than you want can be a challenge
hoursPlayed: but one the game rewards by letting you blow through enemies. Battles are pretty action-packed
voteText: especially because the game doesn't really encourage holding back - during boss fights especially
helpfulPercent: it ends up feeling like every turn is an extreme all-out attack.\n\nI also ended up really clicking with more or less all of the characters. Cram is adoracute. *nods* Also
votesHelpful: especially if you can understand a bit of Japanese
votesTotal: all three of the playable characters (plus Cronos) have amazingly adorable and hilarious voice acting in combat. Even if you can't
commentsCount: the banter between the party outside of combat is really
column16: really good and funny.\n\nSo yeah. Even if I wasn't paid to work on this game
column17: I'd have to recommend it to JRPG fans. For people who aren't into JRPGs very much but still enjoy anime-styled games
column19: especially if their objections are more that JRPGs are long and boring
column21: than that they're too complicated. (If it's that they're too complex... yeah
column22: Planet Ruler's combat system isn't super tough
column23: but it's significantly more in-depth than "hit the bad guy

reviewText:
This is my 2nd review for today, both for very deserving games (the other was for Fairy Fencer F). Now I have honestly of all my time playing JRPGS have never played an RPG Maker game, mainly because they all really looked the same to me. But I have to say Machina of the Planet Tree really stood out for me, so I felt now that I own the game and I have played through some of it, it is deserving of a review (from someone who hardly ever does reviews haha so please bear with me).

Though made from RPG Maker (not sure which I'm assuming the most recent) looks almost nothing like an RPG Maker styled game. The combat is combo based with loads of very stylized and nice looking moves. The story is so far very well done. And the character art looks like it was drawn up by a professional or a group of people who spent lots of hard work and time devolping them. Just overall a game that is currently very deserving of more recongition by the community.

This game being as well made as it is,still has that very classic and turn based styled feel to it. So if that's not your cup of tea maybe this game wouldn't be for you. I only am mentioning this because of how lost the art of turn based RPG's has become. But it's how times change of course. Anyways overall verdict...
A game well put together using a very limited system, almost brings me to the point of being speechless haha. Well deserving of a purchase by any JRPG fan looking for a solid game.

Well that's about it from me! I thank anyone who happens to read this! And of course I hope everyone is doing well and living the best they can! Happy playing my fellow gamers! :)

reviewText:
Pros:
-Fairly balanced and creative battle system
-Harem party?
-Humorous skits

Cons: (Luckily, most of these should be fairly easy to add in without significantly rewriting the story)
-Lack of NPC interaction, especially for some of the antagonists
-Not much backstory for some of the major characters
-Not much customization via accessories. There's literally only two different accessories in the game, and both have the same effect but to a different degree. Unfortunately, there aren't even basic accessories for defending against status effects or elements.

reviewText:
For some reason steam decided to stop recording my tiem in this game after an hour.

Anyways after a number of hours in the game i have a few words to say about it.

Firstly this is the best RPGmaker game on steam, the level of polish and extra script is crazy.

It does have voice acting in battles, its in japanese, you cant really turn this off ingame so i just found the voice files and deleted them.

The story kicks in after around 15 minutes, its pretty decent but not something for the history books, its pretty hilarious though. Im not sure if its the type of game aimed for replayablitily. Afterthat its confusing because as its a JRPG you would expect a lot of grinding, that isnt the case.

Sadly controller support is bad, its always bad with rpgmaker games. it doesnt help that they force you to use arrow keys on the keyboard instead of wasd which is pretty much a standard at this point.

Also animations will surprise you, they are excellent, kudos to whoever did those.

resolution is a pain, its low res at a guess 1024x768 and full screening for some people causes all sorts of issues.

Overall id say its a safe buy. if you like rpgmaker games then get it, if you like anime along with its sillyness get it, if you like jrpgs then do some research first as this is a little different. Combo reminds me of early final fantasy games and that is a very good thing.
voteText: 9 of 10 people (90%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Just finished this game today, and really impressed overall.

The game is around 7 to 10 hour long depending on how fast you can adapt to the combat system (which is pretty simple at first but does have some depth) and if you wanna farm for the last weapons or not (them being optional to finish the game).

Difficulty is pretty well balanced, I think I wiped 3 or 4 times total, and never had to grind during the game except just before the final boss.

Graphisms wise, well it's a rpg maker game, but a pretty good one : the character art is nice, the sprites go from decent to pretty cool. The maps are pretty well made with a definite attention to details.

The music is average with some cool boss themes, but they aren't too agressive and go really well with the mood. Also, the game includes fully friendly character voicing in battle, wich means you get some hype while Cram is shouting things like Gravityyy NOIREEEE and things like that. For people who aren't into that, you can still remove the corresponding files  if you want. The rest of the game isn't voiced sadly, but that goes with budget restriction probably.

The game itself is pretty straightforward, there is basically no side quest except getting new weapons, and while the story will not be remembered forever, it's pretty decent. There is some pretty good comedy in the in game skits and most of the conversations, which will remind some people of the Tales of serie.

Also, to note: a 2.0 version with some added content is to be expected, and this game is basically a test to see if people are interested in it : the studio wants to go for a big full blown rpg sequel if the players reactions are good.

Conclusion : you definitely wanna play this game if you like these rpg maker games in general, it's one of the best in the genre. If you like jrpg in general, you probably wanna get a look at it, the combat system and the interaction between characters are pretty good and worth a try.

reviewText:
I don't really quite get the story since i just barely played around 30 mins for now, so let me at least write about things i have done so far.

Conclusion :
9/10 Should buy this game. I APPROVED OF THIS GAME.

reviewText:
I hate to be a party pooper, but yeah, I'm not gonna recommend this.

I have a couple of issues with the game:
- The combo system is really clunky. It expects you to choose attacks quickly with the combo timer on it, but it also requires you to go through this really archaic battle menu first to choose your command. It encourages you to mix up your attacks to build combo damage, but when mooks resist your attack they resist it a lot, and you can't really exploit weaknesses since using the same attack twice in a row nets you a repetition penalty and decreases your damage. There's also something really weird with mashing action oriented timed combo system with a turn based battle system that encourages you to think carefully first. The game is also unclear about who your characters target next when the mook they're attacking dies mid combo. Which can really ruin your battle.

-The battle menu. Simply put, it is atrocious. It is very unclear, and there's this one submenu where ALL the commands other than Assists and Items are inside of, and it's labeled CUSTOMIZE. It has commands like RUN and CHARGE. What the bloody hell do those commands have to do with customizing?

-The art. Okay so the art for the main characters are actually nice and all, but the NPCs use stock RPG Maker mugs. This makes the game feel really jarring on the eyes sometimes. Also, the backgrounds are just horrible. This is pretty much up to your tastes, but I really disliked the backgrounds, especially the world map, which just feels lazy. They're also incredibly off scale and because of that the character sprites look like they're all Pikmins. Not literally Pikmins, just sizewise. Everything looks so much bigger compared to them in the battle screen. I wouldn't complain so much but the battle screen is literally what you see for 90% of the game, and just slapping over a background like that feels really ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ lazy to me. Enemy sprites are also off scale, so you can have a rat that's twice as big as your guys.

Those are all the issues that I had with this game. I don't know about anyone else's tastes, but these were deal breakers for me, and I'm getting a refund.

The game is competently made indeed, and it has a nice, if generic, plot and premise, but I just can't stomach the issues above. Shame though, I really wanted to like this game. I really did.

reviewText:
A fiarly simple RPG using the RPG Maker VX engine. If you want a game with a complex story, gripping characters, and lots to do, this game isn't for you. If you want a game that's simple, fun, has some interesting fight mechanics, then this game is a fun and quick addition to your library for relatively low cost.


While simple and cliche, the story is relatively good and fits the mold for a quick and relatively short RPG. The combat system is a nice change for most RPG Maker titles, showing that the devs took their time to script the interface and the combat mechanics. The maps are very well done and show attention to detail, environmental effects, and so on. The voice acting in combat is also a nice touch.

Not complex, but a fun play.

reviewText:
F1

I sent an email to support at Sekai Project and received a prompt and courteous response, so I have experienced first hand the care the developers have for their game, and their fanbase. That is most important to me. The game is beautiful, and the storyline is in-depth, and the characters have rapport with one another to a degree. It's light, it moves along, and the characters are playful and comedic. Music is great, battle voices are fun and don't annoy, and monster battles are colorful and fresh. An achievement(s) for this game would be great, if added!

The only shining flaw with the game is its lack of explanation concerning the key bindings or controller. It's visible to most of us when we start up the game for the first time, and the game screen is too small. I had to research before I even started playing to figure out how to fix it. I'm also disappointed that I can't take screenshots. When you press F12, the game resets to the opening screen.

Address and fix those minor nuances, and Sekai Project has a perfect game and even more adoration :)

reviewText:
Impressive game for RPG maker !


ในที่สุดก็เล่นจบซะทีครับเกมนี้
หลังจากหยุดเล่นไปนาน เพราะบอสตัวสุดท้ายมันหินใช้ได้เลยครับ

ประทับใจเกมนี้มากกว่าที่คิดตอนแรกเยอะมากครับ
คือเป็นเกมที่ทำจากRPG maker แต่เขียนโค้ด ทำระบบอินเตอร์เฟสอะไรใหม่หมดเลย
จนแทบไม่(ค่อย)เหลือเค้าของRPG Maker เลยครับ
ประทับใจจุดนี้มากๆ โมเดลอะไรงี้ ใหม่หมด เยี่ยมครับ

เนื้อเรื่องก็ดีครับ เปิดมาเหมือนจะแปลกๆ เชยๆหน่อย พอเดาทางออกได้แหละ
ความยาวถ้าเล่นจริงๆ จะอยู่ที่ประมาณ 9-12 ชม. ครับเกมนี้ ขึ้นกับว่าความพร้อม รวมถึงดวง
ที่จะได้ของดรอปดีๆ มาผสมโดยไม่ต้องไปฟามหรือเปล่า (ผมก็ไม่ได้ฟามของเลย มันดรอปครบพอดีครับ)
แต่ก็ตอนเล่นก็แบบ เล่นยาวจนไม่รู้ตัวเหมือนกันครับ อยากรู้ว่ามันจะเป็นไงต่อ ถึงจะพอเดาได้บ้าง
แต่ก็อยากรู้อยู่ดีครับ 5555 จริงๆก็ไม่ได้ใหม่เท่าไหร่หรอกครับ ก็ยังกึ่งๆ ตามหาโน่น ไปปิดผนึกนี่เหมือนเคย

เกมเพลย์สนุกในระดับนึงเลยฮะ ตอนต่อสู้นี่ แรกๆก็เบื่อๆเพราะสกิล(ในเกมเรียกArt)ยังมีน้อยแหละครับ
หลังๆมีสกิลเยอะๆ เราผสมหาคอมโบเองไ้ด้ คอมโบเฉพาะที่เราชอบ เหมาะกับเลเวล ค่าCost(ค่าร่ายนั่นแหละ)
หรือพื้นที่นั้นๆ อันนี้สนุกครับ ถึงสกิลจะมีไม่มากก็ตาม แต่ตอนผสมคอมโบก็สนุกครับ
แถมมีเรื่องการกดเกจเพิ่มเติม ให้เป็นท่าพิเศษที่แรงขึ้น หรือเอาแต้มนั้นไปใช้Supportสกิล ก็หลากหลายดีครับ เกมนี้ระบบต่อสู้ใหม่ดี(สำหรับผมนะ)

แถมยังไม่ค่อยต้องไต่ฟามมอนที่เดิมๆมาก ส่วนมากคือ
เลเวลเราจะพอดีพอเหมาะกับมอนและบอสในพื้นที่นั้นๆแทบจะตลอดเลยครับ มีไม่กี่ที่ที่จำเป็นต้องฟาร์ม
ตรงจุดนี้ก็ชอบครับ ไม่สะดุดดี คือเกม RPG ส่วนมาก(โดยเฉพาะในRPG maker )
จะเน้นการฟามมอนเยอะๆ แทนการเพิ่มเกมเพลย์หรือส่วนต่างๆเข้ามา เพื่อให้เกมรู้สึกเหมือนนานขึ้น
(คือไม่ได้ผิดหรอกครับ แต่บางทีมันก็เกินไป) เกมนี้มีแค่สามจุดเองมั้งครับที่ผมฟามเวล ก่อนไปสู้บอส
(จุด1-2 ฟาม 1-2เวล ส่วนจุดสามคือบอสตัวสุดท้าย อันนี้ฟามเยอะสุดในเกมละครับ 555)

อาร์ตเวิร์คก็สวยครับ อาจเพราะเป็นสไตล์ที่ผมชอบด้วย เลยโอเค มุกตลก อะไรนิดหน่อย
คาแรคเตอร์มีชีวิตชีวาดีครับ ออกแนวตามประสาตัวละครจากอนิเมแหละครับ

จริงๆบางจุดก็เสียดายเหมือนกัน เดินเรื่องเป็นเส้นตรงไปหน่อยครับ เสียดายบางตัวละครด้วย
มีบทนิดเดียว ทั้งที่คาดว่าน่าจะมีสำคัญ 555
เอ้อ ถ้าเกมนี้มีแอคชีฟเม้นนะ คงขายดีและน่าจะสนุกกว่านี้มากๆครับ ในการไล่เก็บแอคชีฟเม้น
ดูน่าจะมีผลกับการเล่นเพิ่มขึ้นมากๆฮะ

แต่รวมๆแล้วถือว่าประทับใจครับ ในระดับของเกม RPG Maker ที่ทำได้ดีขนาดนี้ !

reviewText: Well, I've tried and tried and tried again and I can't get the game to run without freezing, so i'd say be careful before buying this title.  Its a risky move as multipul people have experienced this issue and dispite questions being asked, no one has any solution or even comment on it so just be wary.  For me thou, I'd say it'd need to be better bug tested before being released to stop people from wasting money on a game that may not work at all and furthermore force them to restart their PC each time they try to play it.

reviewText: This game appears so small on my screen, that I can barely see it.  No option to enlarge it makes it, for me, unplayable. Not worth purchasing, even for its low price in my opinion.

reviewText:
A short and simple JRPG that will leave most gamers wanting for more.

Let's get the main technical complaint out of the way first: the game runs in tiny 640x480 resolution.

Your party consists of 3 characters. Cram is the main lead who, together with Cronos, serves as the warrior class of the group. There is Retla, who has a sort of cat-theme going on with her kitty hood, bell, cat tail, and what we in the trade call Big Fat Cat Tats". She's the typical rogue of the group
date: with high speed and avoidance. Final member of the group is Estiole or Esty
recommended: who fits the mage role with her high magic attack.\n\nThe combat system is a mix of building up the combo counter and the standard RPG fare of exploiting enemy weaknesses. Each skill has its own "Over-Arts" version
hoursPlayed: which makes it more powerful but consumes TP upon use and doesn't restore any upon hitting the enemy. Using the same skill multiple times in a row incurs a repetition penalty. While there is some depth to the system
voteText: I found that just toggling between normal and Over-Arts version of one skill a simple and effective strategy.\n\nWhen a character's TP bar is full
helpfulPercent: they can enter "Over-Tension" mode which doubles the amount action points available
votesHelpful: leading to very high combo and damage potential. Early in the game you might use this as a quick way to finish bosses when their HP is low
votesTotal: but later on the bosses' HP regeneration goes through the roof
votesFunny: forcing your damage dealers to enter Over-Tension as often as possible just to keep up with the regen
commentsCount: while others support them with TP potions and healing.\n\nBattles look great. While enemy monsters only have static sprites
column16: player characters are smoothly animated and their flashy skills
column18: look like they really pack a punch. Transition from skill to skill also looks seamless most of the time.\n\nThe characters are fully voiced during the battle and right after the battle. Unfortunately these are not translated from their original Japanese
column19: which is a shame as the after-battle banter is often quite playful. Voice acting is high quality across the board
column20: but Retla's voice actress in particular strikes me as talented.\n\nSome of the tunes are good
column21: like the main battle theme and the final dungeon theme
column22: but overall the soundtrack is all over the place. I don't mean that they're bad
column23: just that there is quite a bit of variation to the point that they don't feel like they belong on the same soundtrack. After you finish the game
column24: you are teleported into a music room where you can listen to the songs at leisure.\n\nThe story is hard to follow at times
column27: and other such etherbabble. Your journey follows the repeating pattern of "open this seal
column30: fight this guardian boss". These worlds have a standard RPG theme
column32: with matching enemies. There are some puzzles
column33: or at least puzzling map layouts. There are only a few NPCs in the town
column36: and the shop. This is very much a dungeon-focused RPG.\n\nAll dungeons have excavations points scattered throughout. You can excavate these points to get restoratives and crafting components. What you get is randomized and each point can only be excavated around 6 or so times
column37: but resting at the inn resets them. You probably won't be revisiting these areas however
column38: as there is rarely need to grind EXP
column39: and the crafting system as a whole is severely lacking. Often times the crafted weapons are worse than what the character would normally wear
column40: e.g. severely cutting attack while slightly increasing agility or defense.\n\nWait
column41: defensive weapons? That's because there is no real armor in the game. Characters have slots for weapon
column43: and accessory. Only the weapon slot has choices; your armor stays the same
column44: and the accessory slot remains empty until the very last chapter when the one and only type of accessory appears in the shop.\n\nGame length is about 7-11 hours. There are definite shortcomings
column45: but I think the 10 hours I spent were pleasant."
